info.title: CCIP Docs config API
info.description:
API for retrieving CCIP chain, token, lane, and rate limits information.

To get started quickly, you can download our [Postman Collection](/api/ccip/v1/postman-collection.json) which includes all endpoints and example requests.

tags.name: lanes
tags.description: Cross-chain lane information endpoints with rate limits

get.description: Returns information about Cross-Chain Interoperability Protocol (CCIP) chains across different blockchain families (EVM, Solana, Aptos)

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The network environment to query

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Filter by chain ID (e.g., "1" for Ethereum, "56" for BSC, or a Solana pubkey)

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: Filter by CCIP chain selector. Multiple selectors can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: internalId
parameters.description: Filter by internal chain identifier. Multiple IDs can be specified using comma-separated values (e.g., "ethereum-mainnet,bsc-mainnet")

parameters.name: outputKey
parameters.description: Key to use for organizing the response data

parameters.name: enrichFeeTokens
parameters.description: When set to 'true', returns detailed fee token information including addresses, names, and decimals instead of just symbol strings

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Unified search query. Automatically detects query type: selector (>17 digits), chainId (≤17 digits or Solana base58 hash), internalId (kebab-case), or displayName (fuzzy text search). Cannot be combined with chainId, selector, or internalId filters.

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: Filter results by chain family. Only effective when using the search parameter.

parameters.name: internalIdFormat
parameters.description: Format for internal IDs in the response. 'selector' uses canonical selector names (e.g., 'ethereum-mainnet'), 'directory' uses chains.json keys (e.g., 'mainnet'). Only applies when outputKey=internalId.

search.summary: Search response (includes both supported and unsupported chains)

enriched.summary: Enriched response (detailed objects for feeTokens when enrichFeeTokens=true)

get.description: Returns information about Cross-Chain Interoperability Protocol (CCIP) supported tokens. The response includes token details organized by token symbol, with chain-specific information nested under each token and indexed by chain ID or selector (depending on the outputKey parameter).

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The network environment to query

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: Filter by token canonical identifier (e.g., "LINK" for Chainlink token, or "LINK,ETH" for multiple tokens)

parameters.name: chain_id
parameters.description: Filter by chain ID where the token is supported (e.g., "1" for Ethereum, or "1,56" for Ethereum and BSC)

parameters.name: outputKey
parameters.description: Key to use for organizing the response data

parameters.name: internalIdFormat
parameters.description: Format for internal IDs in the response. 'selector' uses canonical selector names (e.g., 'ethereum-mainnet'), 'directory' uses chains.json keys (e.g., 'mainnet'). Only applies when outputKey=internalId.

get.summary: Retrieve detailed token information with custom finality data
get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific CCIP token, including chain-specific configurations and custom finality settings (minBlockConfirmation and hasCustomFinality).

parameters.name: tokenCanonicalSymbol
parameters.description: The canonical symbol for the token (e.g., LINK, USDC, BETS)

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The network environment to query

parameters.name: outputKey
parameters.description: Key to use for organizing the response data by chain

parameters.name: internalIdFormat
parameters.description: Format for internal IDs in the response. 'selector' uses canonical selector names (e.g., 'ethereum-mainnet'), 'directory' uses chains.json keys (e.g., 'mainnet'). Only applies when outputKey=internalId.

200.description: Successful response with token detail data

v2Pool.summary: v2.0 pool (BETS) with CCV features enabled
v2Pool.description: For v2.0+ pools (supportsV2Features=true), ccvConfig contains thresholdAmount and customFinality shows block confirmation settings. Different chains may show different scenarios: customFinality enabled (minBlockConfirmation > 0), disabled (minBlockConfirmation = 0), or downstream API error (both null).

v1Pool.summary: v1.x pool (GHO) with CCV features not supported
v1Pool.description: For v1.x pools (supportsV2Features=false), both ccvConfig and customFinality are null because these features are not supported by v1.x pools.

get.summary: Retrieve token directory data for a specific chain
get.description: Returns detailed token configuration for a specific chain, including pool information, CCV (Cross-Chain Verifier) configuration, and lane-specific verifiers and rate limits. This endpoint provides the data needed for cross-chain token transfer interfaces.

parameters.name: tokenCanonicalSymbol
parameters.description: The canonical symbol for the token (e.g., LINK, USDC, LBTC)

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The source chain identifier (e.g., mainnet, ethereum-testnet-sepolia)

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The network environment to query

parameters.name: outputKey
parameters.description: Key format to use for lane keys in the response

parameters.name: internalIdFormat
parameters.description: Format for internalId values in the response. 'selector' uses canonical selector names (e.g., 'ethereum-mainnet'), 'directory' uses chains.json keys (e.g., 'mainnet').

200.description: Successful response with token directory data

v2Pool.summary: v2.0 pool (LBTC) with CCV features enabled
v2Pool.description: For v2.0+ pools (supportsV2Features=true), ccvConfig contains thresholdAmount and verifiers include additional threshold verifiers in aboveThreshold array. customFinality shows block confirmation settings.

v1Pool.summary: v1.x pool (GHO) with CCV features not supported
v1Pool.description: For v1.x pools (supportsV2Features=false), both ccvConfig and customFinality are null because these features are not supported. Verifiers in lanes are also null.

get.description: Returns information about Cross-Chain Interoperability Protocol (CCIP) lanes between supported chains. Each lane represents a unidirectional connection from a source chain to a destination chain, with associated onRamp and offRamp contracts and supported tokens.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The network environment to query

parameters.name: sourceChainId
parameters.description: Filter by source chain ID. Multiple chain IDs can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: destinationChainId
parameters.description: Filter by destination chain ID. Multiple chain IDs can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: sourceSelector
parameters.description: Filter by source chain CCIP selector. Multiple selectors can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: destinationSelector
parameters.description: Filter by destination chain CCIP selector. Multiple selectors can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: sourceInternalId
parameters.description: Filter by source chain internal identifier. Multiple IDs can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: destinationInternalId
parameters.description: Filter by destination chain internal identifier. Multiple IDs can be specified using comma-separated values

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by lane version. Only lanes where both onRamp and offRamp match the specified version will be returned

parameters.name: outputKey
parameters.description: Key format to use for organizing the lane keys in the response

parameters.name: internalIdFormat
parameters.description: Format for internal IDs in the response. 'selector' uses canonical selector names (e.g., 'ethereum-mainnet'), 'directory' uses chains.json keys (e.g., 'mainnet'). Only applies when outputKey=internalId.

ignoredChainCount.description: Number of chains ignored due to configuration issues

validChainCount.description: Number of valid chains in the response

searchQuery.description: The search query that was used (only present when search parameter was provided)

searchType.description: The detected type of search query (only present when search parameter was provided)

SearchType.description: The detected type of search query. 'selector' for CCIP selectors (>17 digits), 'chainId' for chain IDs (≤17 digits or Solana base58), 'internalId' for kebab-case identifiers, 'displayName' for fuzzy text search.

address.description: Token contract address on this chain

decimals.description: Number of decimals for the token

chainId.description: Identifier of the chain (numeric for EVM chains, string for Solana/Aptos chains)

displayName.description: Human-readable name of the chain. For supported chains, this comes from configuration. For unsupported chains, it is derived from the internalId.

oneOf.description: List of supported fee token symbols (when enrichFeeTokens=false)

feeTokens.description: Fee tokens - either as string symbols or enriched objects with addresses. Empty array for unsupported chains.

router.description: CCIP Router contract address. Empty string for unsupported chains.

rmn.description: Risk Management Network contract address. Empty string for unsupported chains.

supported.description: Whether this chain is fully supported with complete configuration. Unsupported chains have minimal details (empty router, rmn, feeTokens).

registryModule.description: Registry Module contract address (EVM chains only)

tokenAdminRegistry.description: Token Admin Registry contract address (EVM and Aptos chains)

tokenPoolFactory.description: Token Pool Factory contract address (EVM chains only)

mcms.description: MCMS (Multi-Chain Management Service) address (Aptos chains only)

chainId.description: Chain ID of the failed configuration

networkId.description: Network identifier of the failed configuration

evm.description: EVM chain details keyed by the specified output key

solana.description: Solana chain details keyed by the specified output key

aptos.description: Aptos chain details keyed by the specified output key

sui.description: Sui chain details keyed by the specified output key

tron.description: Tron chain details keyed by the specified output key

canton.description: Canton chain details keyed by the specified output key

ton.description: TON chain details keyed by the specified output key

stellar.description: Stellar chain details keyed by the specified output key

starknet.description: Starknet chain details keyed by the specified output key

data.description: Chain details grouped by chain family

ignored.description: List of chains that could not be configured

ignoredLaneCount.description: Number of lanes ignored due to configuration issues

validLaneCount.description: Number of valid lanes in the response

ChainInfo.description: Chain information used in lane endpoints. Note: chainType and chainFamily are intentionally excluded from this schema for API responses.

chainId.description: Identifier of the chain (numeric for EVM chains, string for Solana/Aptos chains)

selector.description: CCIP chain selector as a string

version.description: Normalized semantic version of the OnRamp contract

enforceOutOfOrder.description: Whether the OnRamp enforces out-of-order execution

version.description: Normalized semantic version of the OffRamp contract

supportedTokens.description: List of supported token keys (e.g., LINK, CCIP-BnM, USDC)

sourceChain.description: Source chain identifier that failed configuration

destinationChain.description: Destination chain identifier that failed configuration

reason.description: Human-readable reason for the configuration failure

missingFields.description: List of missing or invalid configuration fields

data.description: Lane data organized by dynamic lane keys (e.g., '1_to_56', 'ethereum-mainnet_to_polygon-mainnet')

ignored.description: List of lanes that could not be configured

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging and support

ignoredTokenCount.description: Number of tokens ignored due to configuration issues

validTokenCount.description: Number of valid tokens in the response

chainId.description: Identifier of the chain (numeric for EVM chains, string for Solana/Aptos chains)

tokenAddress.description: Token contract address on this chain

decimals.description: Number of decimals used for the token

poolType.description: Type of pool for this token

chainId.description: Identifier of the chain (numeric for EVM chains, string for Solana/Aptos chains)

tokenAddress.description: Token contract address on this chain

decimals.description: Number of decimals used for the token

poolType.description: Type of pool for this token

destinations.description: Destination chains this token can be sent to

TokenDetailChainData.description: Extended token chain data with custom finality and CCV information

customFinality.description: Custom finality configuration for v2.0+ pools. Null for v1.x pools (check pool.supportsV2Features). When present with hasCustomFinality=null and minBlockConfirmation=null, indicates downstream API error.

ccvConfig.description: CCV configuration for v2.0+ pools. Null for v1.x pools (check pool.supportsV2Features). When present with thresholdAmount=null, indicates downstream API error.

advancedPoolHooks.description: Address of advanced pool hooks contract, or null if not configured

supportsV2Features.description: Whether this pool supports v2 features (customFinality, ccvConfig). When true and these fields have null values inside, it indicates a downstream API error rather than feature not supported.

pool.description: Pool information including version, hooks, and v2 feature support flag

tokenSymbol.description: Canonical symbol of the requested token

chainCount.description: Number of chains this token is available on

data.description: Token data indexed by chain ID/selector, including custom finality information

lanes.description: Available token lanes: source chain to array of destination chains

chains.description: Detailed information about the token on each chain

additionalProperties.description: Map of chain IDs/selectors to chain-specific token details

data.description: Token data indexed by token symbol and then by chain ID/selector

ignored.description: List of tokens that were ignored due to configuration issues

symbol.description: Canonical symbol of the requested token

LaneVerifiers.description: Pre-computed verifier sets for different transfer amounts. Only present for v2.0+ pools (supportsV2Features=true). For v1.x pools, the entire verifiers field is null. Values: empty array [] = no verifiers configured, [addr1, ...] = verifiers configured, null = downstream API error.

belowThreshold.description: Verifier addresses used when transfer amount is below the threshold. Empty array [] if no verifiers configured, null if downstream API error.

aboveThreshold.description: Verifier addresses used when transfer amount is at or above the threshold (includes all belowThreshold verifiers plus additional threshold verifiers). Empty array [] if no verifiers configured, null if downstream API error.

RateLimiterConfig.description: Rate limit configuration for a single direction (in or out)

capacity.description: Maximum capacity of the rate limiter bucket (in token's smallest unit)

rate.description: Rate at which the bucket refills (tokens per second in smallest unit)

DirectionalRateLimits.description: Rate limits for both directions (in and out) on a lane

TokenRateLimits.description: Rate limits for both standard and custom transfers, each with in/out directions

custom.description: Custom (custom block confirmation) transfer rate limit configuration

LaneFees.description: Transfer fees for a lane in basis points (1 bps = 0.01%)

standardTransferFeeBps.description: Standard transfer fee in basis points

customTransferFeeBps.description: custom (custom block confirmation) transfer fee in basis points

TokenDirectoryLane.description: Lane configuration for outbound or inbound transfers. Use pool.supportsV2Features to interpret verifiers: false + null = v1.x pool (not supported), true + {null, null} = downstream error, true + {[], []} = not configured, true + {[...], [...]} = configured.

internalId.description: Internal identifier of the remote chain (destination for outbound, source for inbound)

chainId.description: Chain ID of the remote chain

selector.description: CCIP chain selector of the remote chain

rateLimits.description: Rate limits for both standard and custom transfers, with in/out directions

fees.description: Transfer fees in basis points, or null if not configured

verifiers.description: Verifier configuration. For v1.x pools (pool.supportsV2Features=false): null. For v2.x pools: object with arrays or null values.

CCVConfig.description: Cross-Chain Verifier (CCV) configuration for a pool. Only present for v2.0+ pools (check pool.supportsV2Features). For v1.x pools, the entire ccvConfig field is null.

thresholdAmount.description: Amount threshold (in token's smallest unit) above which additional threshold verifiers are required. Values: '0' = CCV not configured for this pool, 'N' (positive number) = CCV configured with threshold N, null = downstream API error fetching CCV config.

advancedPoolHooks.description: Address of advanced pool hooks contract, or null if not configured

supportsV2Features.description: Whether this pool supports v2 features (customFinality, ccvConfig). When true and these fields have null values inside, it indicates a downstream API error rather than feature not supported.

CustomFinalityConfig.description: Custom finality configuration for the token on this chain. Only present for v2.0+ pools (check pool.supportsV2Features). For v1.x pools, the entire customFinality field is null. When both hasCustomFinality and minBlockConfirmation are null inside the object, it indicates a downstream API error for a v2.x pool.

hasCustomFinality.description: Whether custom finality is enabled (derived from minBlockConfirmation > 0). Null indicates downstream API error.

minBlockConfirmation.description: Minimum block confirmations required. Null indicates downstream API error.

TokenDirectoryData.description: Token directory data for a specific chain

ccvConfig.description: CCV configuration for v2.0+ pools. Null for v1.x pools (check pool.supportsV2Features). When present with thresholdAmount=null, indicates downstream API error.

customFinality.description: Custom finality configuration for v2.0+ pools. Null for v1.x pools (check pool.supportsV2Features). When present with hasCustomFinality=null and minBlockConfirmation=null, indicates downstream API error.

outboundLanes.description: Outbound lanes indexed by destination chain ID

inboundLanes.description: Inbound lanes indexed by source chain ID
